text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.82.2, Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines, Arbitrage Payment Refund Claim Procedures .
Incorporates new text, reissues existing information and reﬂects editorial changes and updates to IRM references. The signiﬁcant changes to this IRM are listed in the table below:

IRM Reference Change 4.82.2.7, Processing a Fully Allowed Refund Claim Incorporated key provisions from Rev. Proc. 2008-37 including the time allowance for issuer response and basis for denial. Added new text and included RCCMS closing instructions. 4.82.2.11, Processing a Fully Denied Refund Claim Added new text including revised procedure reﬂecting impact of issuer’s signature on Form 2297. 4.82.2.12, Processing a Fully Denied Refund Claim with Addi- tional Amounts Due Added new text. 4.82.2.13, Processing a Rejected Refund Claim with Additional Amounts Due Incorporated key provisions from Rev. Proc. 2008-37 including time allowance for issuer response and basis for rejection. 4.82.2.16, Request for Reconsid- eration of a Disallowed Refund Claim Added new text. 4.82.18, Mandatory Review Added new text. 4.82.2.20, Disaster Assistance and Emergency Relief Added new section.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This supersedes IRM 4.82.2 dated September 20, 2018.
AUDIENCE
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Exempt Organizations and Government Entities Government Entities Tax Exempt Bonds
Acting Director, Exempt Organizations and Government Entities Tax Exempt and Government Entities
Table of Contents
Program Scope and Objectives
Arbitrage Payment Refund Claim Procedures 4.82.2 page 1
Scope and (
) Purpose: This IRM provides basic examination procedures that will enable Exempt Bonds (TEB) employees to process claims for recovery of overpay- ment of arbitrage payments (refund claims). (
) Audience: This manual provides procedures for TEB revenue agents (examiners) to process arbitrage refund claims. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Exempt Organizations/Government Entities (
) Program Owner: Director, Exempt Organizations/Government Entities (
) Contact Information: To recommend changes or make any other suggestions related to this IRM section, see IRM
, Providing Feedback About an IRM Section - Outside of Clearance. (
) Authority: TEB’s examination authority to resolve claims for recovery of over- payment of arbitrage payments is derived from IRC

and its regulations. a. The Regulations state that an issuer may recover an overpayment for issue of tax-exempt bonds by establishing to the satisfaction of the Com- missioner that the overpayment occurred. b.
CFR
)(i) permits the recovery of overpayment of yield reduction payments. c. Rev. Proc.
provides additional guidance to issuers of tax-exempt bonds regarding procedures for ﬁling a refund claim. d. Rev. Proc.
modiﬁes Rev. Proc.
to extend the deadline for ﬁling claims. e. The Form
-R instructions provide guidance to issuers for ﬁling a refund claim. Controls (
) Compliance Planning & Classiﬁcation (CP&C) administers inventory control refund claims. (
) The Functional Assignment Coordinator (FAC) coordinates the refund claims inventory.
Authority: TEB’s examination authority to resolve claims for recovery of over- payment of arbitrage payments is derived from IRC 148 and its regulations.
a. The Regulations state that an issuer may recover an overpayment for an issue of tax-exempt bonds by establishing to the satisfaction of the Com- missioner that the overpayment occurred. b.
CFR
)(i) permits the recovery of overpayment of yield reduction payments. c. Rev. Proc.
provides additional guidance to issuers of tax-exempt bonds regarding procedures for ﬁling a refund claim. d. Rev. Proc.
modiﬁes Rev. Proc.
to extend the deadline for ﬁling claims. e. The Form
-R instructions provide guidance to issuers for ﬁling a refund claim.
) Compliance Planning & Classiﬁcation (CP&C) administers inventory control of refund claims. (
) The Functional Assignment Coordinator (FAC) coordinates the refund claims inventory. (
) TEB exam groups (TEB Exam) examine refund claims. (
) TEB Technical (Technical) provides TEB Exam technical assistance and performs mandatory review of certain refund claims as described in this IRM. (

) The primary objective of the refund claim examination and approval process is to determine whether a refund claim should be paid in the amount requested (or in some other amount) based on IRS review of the Form
-R and any supporting documents and reports. (
) An issuer of tax-exempt bonds, tax credit bonds, and other ﬁnancing subject to IRC
with a recoverable overpayment can ﬁle refund claims using Form
-R, Request for Recovery and Overpayments Under Arbitrage Rebate Provisions.
TEB Technical (Technical) provides TEB Exam technical assistance and performs mandatory review of certain refund claims as described in this IRM.
An issuer of tax-exempt bonds, tax credit bonds, and other ﬁnancing subject to IRC
with a recoverable overpayment can ﬁle refund claims using Form
-R, Request for Recovery and Overpayments Under Arbitrage Rebate Provisions.
4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines

The TEB Exam group managers assign cases to examiners; review the exam- iner’s work for accuracy and completeness; coordinate the case closing; and ensure examiners follow all other procedures contained in this IRM.

Form, Pub or Letter Name Description Form 907 Agreement to Extend Time to Bring Suit Form 2297 Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁcation of Claim for Refund or Credit Form 2848 Power of Attorney and Declaration of Representative Form 3210 Document Transmittal Form 3363 Acceptance of Proposed Disallow- ance of Claim for Refund or Credit Form 3753 Manual Refund Posting Voucher Form 4564 Information Document Request Form 5773 Workpaper Summary Form 8038-R Request for Recovery of Overpay- ment Under Arbitrage Rebate Provisions Form 8038-T Arbitrage Rebate and Penalty in Lieu of Arbitrage Rebate Form 8821 Tax Information Authorization Letter 105-T TEB Arbitrage Claim Incomplete for Processing - No Consideration Letter 937 Transmittal Letter for Power of Attorney Letter 5677 Arbitrage Claim Notiﬁcation of Final Adverse Determination Letter 5678 TEB Form 8038-R Examination Noti- ﬁcation Letter 5684 Arbitrage Claim Notiﬁcation of Proposed Claim Disallowance Letter 5761 Arbitrage Claim Allowed In Full Letter 5918 Protest Received Rebuttal / Transfer to Appeals Publication 1 Your Rights as a Taxpayer Publication 5 Your Appeal Rights and How to Prepare a Protest If You Don’t Agree Refund Claim Procedures 4.82.2
Unless otherwise noted, all terms deﬁned under IRC 148, its regulations and Rev. Proc. 2008-37 apply to these procedures.
) A refund claim is a request for a refund of an overpayment of arbitrage payments, including arbitrage rebate amounts, yield reduction payments and penalty in lieu of rebate. (
) An overpayment is the excess of the amount paid over the sum of the “rebate amount” (as deﬁned in
CFR
(b)) as of the most recent “computation date” (per
CFR
(e)) and all amounts otherwise required to be paid under IRC
as of the refund claim date. (

) Unless otherwise noted: i) an allowance of a refund claim is a refund claim approval and ii) a partial disallowance (denial) is similar to an adverse determi- nation in that it’s initially treated as proposed and doesn’t become ﬁnal until: a. Accepted by the issuer. b. Issuer fails to timely request an administrative appeal. c. The IRS Independent Office of Appeals makes a ﬁnal determination regarding the refund claim.
) and Establishment (
) An issuer ﬁles an arbitrage claim with the Ogden Service Center (Ogden Campus) using Form
-R to recover an overpayment of: • arbitrage rebate • a yield reduction payment • a penalty in lieu of rebate (
) Exempt Organizations (EO) Accounts staff review the claim to determine whether the issuer has satisﬁed the initial processing requirements as described in IRM

, Business Tax Returns and Non-Master File Accounts, Exempt Organizations and Tax Exempt Bonds, TEB Claim Proce- dures and routes the claim to TEGE Compliance Planning & Classiﬁcation, Classiﬁcation & Case Assignment.
) Classiﬁcation and Assignment (
) The refund claim is classiﬁed when CP&C receives a refund claim case ﬁle accordance with IRM
, TEGE Examinations, Classiﬁcation and Assignment CP&C Procedures, Claims/Requests for Abatement. For refund claim examinations, the FAC assigns the case per IRM
, TEB Conduct- ing the Examination, Case Assignment.
) Claim Examination Process (
) Examiner: When you’re assigned a case: a. Acknowledge the Form
and keep a copy for the Form
logbook. b. Begin the refund claim examination as soon as possible, but no later than
days after receipt and note any delays on the Form
, Chronology Record. c. Send the opening Letter
, TEB Form
-R Examination Notiﬁca- tion; Pub
, Your Rights as a Taxpayer; any Form
, Information Document Request; and any required Letter
notifying the issuer its refund claim is being examined. d. Update the case to AIMS status
as soon as time is applied to the case. e. Contact the issuer and any authorized representative
calendar days after mailing Letter
if the issuer or the issuer’s representative contacted you.
Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines
4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines
An issuer ﬁles an arbitrage claim with the Ogden Service Center (Ogden Campus) using Form 8038-R to recover an overpayment of:
Acknowledge the Form
and keep a copy for the Form
logbook. Begin the refund claim examination as soon as possible, but no later than
days after receipt and note any delays on the Form
, Case Chronology Record. Send the opening Letter
, TEB Form
-R Examination Notiﬁca- tion; Pub
, Your Rights as a Taxpayer; any Form
, Information Document Request; and any required Letter
notifying the issuer that its refund claim is being examined. Update the case to AIMS status
as soon as time is applied to the case. Contact the issuer and any authorized representative
calendar days after mailing Letter
if the issuer or the issuer’s representative hasn’t contacted you.
Arbitrage Payment Refund Claim Procedures 4.82.2
Verify the issuer submitted the refund claim timely per IRC 148 and the applicable regulations. Follow these procedures:
If the refund claim was submitted timely:
4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines
Identify the appropriate review scope of the examination on Form
, Workpaper Summary, and the documents required to conduct the examination.
If all required documents aren’t included with the assigned RCCMS ﬁle or in the paper case ﬁle, prepare Form
, Infor- mation Document Request, and request these items with the Letter
, TEB Form
-R Examination Notiﬁcation.
Follow the appropriate IDR procedures found in IRM

, Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Program and Procedures, Con- ducting the Examination, Securing Records. The scope is limited to the merits of the claim. However, if a potential violation unrelated to the merits of the refund claim is identiﬁed during the exam, the examiner must notify the TEB Exam group manager and obtain approval to expand the scope of the examination.
As the examination continues, you may request additional documents necessary to determine whether the claim is allowable. Allow the issuer at least

days to provide additional information in support of the refund claim for procedural deﬁcien- cies or incomplete information. i. Using IDRS, verify IRS receipt of payments including all arbitrage rebate, yield reduction, penalty in lieu of arbitrage rebate, any applicable under- payment interest and penalty purportedly paid according to the rebate report(s) and ancillary documents provided by the issuer. Resolve any crepancies and recalculate any underpayment and penalty interest to determine if the payments are correct. j. Ensure all previously ﬁled Forms

-T, Arbitrage Rebate, Yield Reduction and Penalty in Lieu of Arbitrage Rebate, along with the related payments discussed above, are established on AIMS and RCCMS. k. Verify whether any prior refund was approved and paid using the BMFOLT in the case ﬁle. A refund appears with a transaction code of
Note: A transaction code

means the previously issued refund claim refund check was undeliverable. Check the TXMOD transaction code for any actions taken on the undeliverable/returned refund claim check and follow-up as necessary. l. Use appropriate workpapers speciﬁcally developed for this type of examina- tion, if available. m. Discuss the issue(s) with the issuer or the issuer’s representative as as you determine that all or a portion of the refund claim might be denied. If you require additional information, see IRM

)(h). If the issue(s) remain unresolved, discuss the issue(s) with your manager. Generally, TEB will deny (or disallow) a refund claim, in full or in part, if the examina- tion determines the correct amount of overpayment is less than the requested overpayment amounts, or no overpayment occurred. n. If the claim is to be disallowed in whole or in part, with your manager’s agreement per IRM
, Communicating Identiﬁed Issues, prepare and secure e-mail your manager: • Letter
• Form
-A • Form
• Form
, and • any Letter

o. Group manager: When you receive the above package, sign Letter TEB Arbitrage Claim Notiﬁcation of Proposed Claim Disallowance, for PM and mail to the issuer via certiﬁed mail/return receipt requested: • Letter

, Transmittal for Power of Attorney, via regular mail. Send secure e-mail copies to the examiner via secure e-mail. p. Examiner: If the issuer agrees with the proposed determination:
Prepare and organize the work papers, case chronology record, letters, documents and forms for closing upon exam completion per IRM
, Case Closing Procedures.
Assemble the case ﬁle per IRM
, Case File Assembly, and recommend full allowance, partial disallowance, full disallow- ance or rejection (under section
)(b) of Rev. Proc.
or under
CFR
)(iii)(B) for a refund claim rejection after the two year deadline in
CFR
)(i), as modiﬁed by Rev. Proc.

, Pro- cessing a Rejected Refund Claim.

and Form
, Manual Refund Posting Voucher, if not a full disallowance.

Upload documents into RCCMS and request closure when you receive signed copies of issued closing letters from the TEB Exam group manager. q. If the issuer doesn’t agree with the proposed determination and ﬁles a protest requesting consideration of the case by the IRS Independent of Appeals, close the case per unagreed issue procedures in IRM r. If the issuer doesn’t agree with the recommendation and doesn’t ﬁle a protest, close the case per unagreed issue procedures in IRM
, TEB Examination Program and Procedures, Unagreed Issues, Mandatory Review and IRM
, TEB Examination Program and Procedures, Unagreed Issues, Final Adverse Determination. s. Using Form

, Document Transmittal, mail the arbitrage claim paper case ﬁle to the TEB Exam group manager, keep a copy in the Form logbook. TEB Exam group manager: When you receive the completed refund claim case ﬁle, review it. If you don’t agree with the examiner’s conclusion, return to them and note required follow-up actions. and ARDI code

in RCCMS, and request review and closure of the RCCMS ﬁle. d. Determine whether any of the paper ﬁle is necessary to support the clusion and, if so, scan and upload into the RCCMS ﬁle. Organize any documents too large for scanning but necessary to support the conclu- sion in a case ﬁle. : (

Don’t agree with the examiner’s recommendation, discuss any issues with them that they must develop and return the RCCMS case ﬁle for further development. , Technical Assistance and Technical Advice Requests. If disagreement remains, elevate the issue(s) to the PM for resolution. b. Agree with the examiner’s recommendation or are otherwise instructed proceed with processing the claim:

, Manual Refund Posting Voucher.

Arbitrage Payment Refund Claim Procedures 4.82.2

a. Return any hardcopy documents not necessary to support the examina- tion conclusion to the issuer or the issuer’s representative. b. For any documents too large for scanning but necessary to support the conclusion in a case ﬁle, prepare Form
retaining a copy in the Form
logbook, and send the paper case ﬁle to the CP&C Planning & Monitoring Closing Unit at the following address for closing: Internal Revenue Service TEGE Closing Unit MS

c. Upon receipt of the paper case ﬁle, the Manager, CP&C, Planning & Monitoring Closing Unit, or other designee, signs the Form
when they receive the paper case ﬁle. Fully Claim Refund (
) If during the examination of a refund claim the examiner determines that a refund in an amount more than originally requested is due, he/she secures an amended Form

-R, Request for Recovery of Overpayment Under Arbitrage Rebate Provisions. If the issuer doesn’t agree with the additional refund amount, the examiner allows the original refund claim as ﬁled. Partially Claim (
) The examiner discusses the proposed partial refund claim denial with the issuer and any authorized representative and secure e-mails to the TEB Exam group manager: • Letter
• Form
-A • Form
• Form
• Publication
• Any required Letter
) If the amount of the allowed refund claim is greater than $
million, it’s subject to mandatory review per IRM
before processing the refund claim. (
) TEB Exam group manager: When you receive the documents:

Return any hardcopy documents not necessary to support the examina- tion conclusion to the issuer or the issuer’s representative. For any documents too large for scanning but necessary to support the conclusion in a case ﬁle, prepare Form
retaining a copy in the Form
logbook, and send the paper case ﬁle to the CP&C Planning & Monitoring Closing Unit at the following address for closing: Internal Revenue Service TEGE Closing Unit MS
N. Rulon White Boulevard Ogden, Utah
Upon receipt of the paper case ﬁle, the Manager, CP&C, Planning & Monitoring Closing Unit, or other designee, signs the Form
when they receive the paper case ﬁle.
) If during the examination of a refund claim the examiner determines that a refund in an amount more than originally requested is due, he/she secures an amended Form
-R, Request for Recovery of Overpayment Under Arbitrage Rebate Provisions. If the issuer doesn’t agree with the additional refund amount, the examiner allows the original refund claim as ﬁled.
4.82.2.8(03-18-2021) Processing a Fully Allowed Refund Claim with Additional Refund Allowed
If the amount of the allowed refund claim is greater than $2 million, it’s subject to mandatory review per IRM 4.82.2.18 before processing the refund claim.

If you don’t agree with the examiner’s recommendations: If you agree with the examiner’s recommendation or are otherwise instructed to proceed: a. Discuss any issues to develop b. If you and the examiner still disagree, you may request technical assistance following the procedures in IRM 4.80.1, Technical Assis- tance and Technical Advice Requests. c. If the disagreement remains, elevate the issue to the PM for resolution. a. Sign Letter 5684, TEB Arbitrage Claim Notiﬁcation of Proposed Claim Disallow- ance for the PM and b. Mail the letter and Form 886-A, Explanation of Items; Form 3363, Acceptance of Proposed Disallowance of Claim for Refund or Credit; Form 2297, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁcation of Claim Disallowance; and Pub 5, Your Appeal Rights and How To Prepare A Protest If You Don’t Agree, to the issuer via certiﬁed mail/return receipt requested and copies to any autho- rized representative using Letter 937, Transmittal for Power of Attorney via regular mail. c. Secure e-mail a copy of the signed Letter 5684 and any Letter 937 to the examiner. (4) Examiner: When you receive the signed Letter 5684 and any Letter 937 from 4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines

Examiner: When you receive the signed Letter 5684 and any Letter 937 from the TEB Exam group manager, update the RCCMS case status to 13 (30-Day Letter) and hold the case ﬁle for 45 days pending the issuer’s response or until signed Form 2297 and Form 3363 are received, if earlier.

Person responsible Action Examiner :1. Secure the issuer’s signature on Form 3363 and Form 2297. 2. Include the completed Form 3753, Manual Refund Posting Voucher, in the case ﬁle for the allowable portion of the refund claim. 3. Organize the refund claim case ﬁle, prepare Form 3210, keep a copy in the Form 3210 logbook, and forward the paper case ﬁle to CP&C Planning & Moni- toring Closing Group at the address in IRM 4.82.2.7 (4). 4. Enter disposal code 102 and ARDI code 3 in RCCMS. Then, request closure of the RCCMS ﬁle. TEB Exam group manager When you receive the case ﬁle, review the completed Form 3753, Manual Refund Posting Voucher, before approving case closure. Manager, CP&C Planning & Monitoring Closing Unit, or other designee When you receive the paper case ﬁle, sign the Form 3753. Refund Claim Procedures 4.82.2 page
If the issuer disagrees with the proposed partial denial and submits a protest:

Person Responsible Action Examiner 1. Follow the procedures in IRM 4.81.14 for unagreed issues. 2. Enter disposal code 601 and ARDI code 2 in RCCMS. 3. Notify the TEB Exam group manager that the issuer has appealed the proposed partial denial and, unless technical review is not required, request transfer of the RCCMS case ﬁle to the TLS assigned to conduct the review. 4. If technical review is not required, inform the TEB Exam group manager that the refund claim is ready for transfer to Appeals and e-mail Letter 5918, Notiﬁca- tion of Transfer to the IRS Independent Office of Appeals, Notiﬁcation of Transfer to the IRS Indepen- dent Office of Appeals, issuer’s protest, rebuttal to the protest and any required Letter 937. 12 4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines

Person Responsible Action TEB Exam group manager When you receive the case: 1. Follow the procedures in IRM 4.81.14 for unagreed issues. 2. If you agree with the prepared rebuttal or are otherwise instructed to proceed:a.Sign Letter 5918, Protest Received Rebuttal/Transfer to Appeals for the PM and mail it with the rebuttal to the issuer, and any authorized representative using Letter 937 informing the issuer that you’ve forwarded the refund claim to Appeals. b. Secure e-mail a copy of the signed Letter 5918, the rebuttal, and any Letter 937 to the examiner. Examiner and TEB Exam group manager If the issuer doesn’t respond to the Letter 5684 after 45 days, follow the procedures in IRM 4.81.14.5 and IRM 4.81.14.6 for unagreed issues. page 13
Reduce an otherwise approved refund claim by any amount determined to be due. These refund claims are processed the same way as partially denied claims. See IRM
Discuss the proposed full refund claim denial with the issuer and any autho- rized representative. Then, send to the TEB Exam group manager:

• Form 2297 • Pub 5 • Any required Letter 937. (3) TEB Exam group manager: If you don’t agree with the examiner’s recommendation: If you agree with the examiner’s recommendation or are otherwise instructed to proceed: a. Discuss any issues with the examiner that need addi- tional development. b. If you still disagree with the examiner, you may request technical assistance per IRM 4.80.1, Technical Assistance and Technical Advice Requests. c. If the disagreement remains, elevate the issue to the PM for resolution. 1. Sign Letter 5684 for the PM, and mail the letter and Form 886-A, Form 3363, Form 2297, and Pub 5 to the issuer via certiﬁed mail/ return receipt requested and copies to any authorized representative using Letter 937, via regular mail. 2. Secure e-mail a copy of the signed Letter 5684 and any Letter 937 to the examiner. (4) Examiner: When you receive the signed Letter 5684 and any Letter 937 from the TEB Exam group manager: 1. Update the RCCMS case status to 13 (30-Day Letter). 2. Hold the case for 45 days pending the issuer’s response or until a signed Form 2297 and Form 3363 are received, if earlier. (5) If the issuer agrees to the proposed full denial: Person Responsible Action Examiner 1. Secure the issuer’s signature on Form 3363 and Form 2297. 2. Prepare Letter 5677, Arbitrage Claim Notiﬁcation of Final Adverse Determina- tion and any Letter 937. 3. Organize the refund claim case ﬁle. 4. Prepare Form 3210 and keep a copy in the Form 3210 logbook. 5. Enter disposal code 303 and ARDI code 2 in RCCMS. Request closure of the RCCMS ﬁle. 4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines

If the issuer disagrees with the proposed full denial and submits a protest:

Person Responsible Action Examiner 1. Follow the unagreed proce- dures in IRM 4.81.14. 2. Prepare Letter 5918, rebuttal to the protest and any required Letter 937 and include in RCCMS case ﬁle along with the issuer’s protest. 3. If technical review is required, request a transfer of the RCCMS case ﬁle to the TLS assigned to conduct the review. 4. If technical review is not required:a.Enter disposal code 601 and ARDI code 2 in RCCMS. b. Inform the TEB Exam group manager that the refund claim is ready for transfer to Appeals.

Person Responsible Action TEB Exam group manager 1. Follow the unagreed proce- dures in IRM 4.81.14 for unagreed issues. 2. If you agree with the prepared rebuttal or are otherwise instructed to proceed:a.Sign Letter 5918 for the PM and mail it with the rebuttal to the issuer, and to any au- thorized representative using Letter 937 informing the issuer that the refund claim case will be forwarded to the IRS Independent Office of Appeals. b. Upload the signed Letter 5918, the rebuttal and any Letter 937 into the RCCMS case ﬁle. 4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines

Enter disposal code 303 in RCCMS, requests closure of the RCCMS ﬁle. 4.82.2.14(09-20-2018) Processing a Withdrawn Refund Claim (1) A refund claim that is withdrawn at the issuer’s request is treated as a refund claim rejection and closed per IRM 4.82.2.13. 4.82.2.15(03-18-2021) Refund Claims in Cases Previously Considered by Appeals (1) If the IRS Independent Office of Appeals has not previously considered a matter raised in the refund claim, process the refund claim according to the procedures in this IRM. (2) If the refund claim relates to a matter resolved with a closing agreement under Code section 7121, treat the refund claim as rejected and close per IRM 4.82.2.13. (3) If the refund claim relates to a matter that the IRS Independent Office of Appeals fully or partially sustained, but the matter was not resolved under a closing agreement, treat the refund claim as a reconsideration of a disallowed claim per IRM 4.82.2.16. page 18 4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines

) A request to reconsider a disallowed refund claim generally results in one the following actions: a. The request is rejected with no appeal rights, if:
The request presents no new information and/or new additional facts.
The issuer ﬁles the request after the statutory period for institut- ing a suit under IRC
has expired.
The issuer ﬁles the request when less than
days of the statutory period remain in which to institute suit (See IRM
(c) below). A Form
, Agreement to Extend the Time to Bring Suit, to suspend the running of the statutory period of limitations under IRC

) may be executed when either of the following is true: • The IRS has under consideration a change in position requiring the suspension of action in all similar cases. • The conclusion on the merits of the request is contingent on the ﬁndings of one or more pending court cases. b. The request is denied because the issuer ﬁled it after the ﬁling deadline in
CFR
)(i), as modiﬁed by Rev. Proc.
, has expired. In this case the issuer is permitted the right of appeal provided in

)(iii). c. The request is accepted and the refund claim is approved in whole or part, requiring the issuance of a letter facilitating the allowance. d. The request is accepted (based on new information) but the refund is disallowed (denied) in whole or in part. The issuer is permitted the of appeal within the IRS for this denial. However, if the period of for instituting suit on the disallowed refund claim will expire in less than six months, the refund claim case is not referred to the IRS Independent Office of Appeals unless that office agrees to accept jurisdiction. 4.82 Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Guidelines
Certain refund claims are subject to mandatory review.

Action Explanation Review the refund claim case ﬁle to identify errors or issues of par- ticular signiﬁcance. Your review is mostly to: • Conﬁrm the examiner’s de- termination for technical accuracy. • Verify they included sup- porting documentation in the ﬁle. Appropriately review the appli- cable underlying documentation to reasonably review the case. For example, you may decide to limit your review to the issue that’s the basis for a denial. You may also: a. Review arbitrage computa- tions and supporting documentation to conﬁrm they’re substantially correct and technically accurate. b. Test computations for select funds and/or investments to independently conﬁrm the calculation method’s accuracy. c. Review the case ﬁle to identify any factors that might substantially impact the calculations’ accuracy or otherwise affect the claim’s validity. Document any needed case de- velopment and return the refund claim case to the examiner. If you determine that additional development is needed to concur with the examiner’s determina- tion. Close the refund claim case per IRM 4.81.5.24, Tax Exempt Bonds Examination Program and Procedures, Conducting the Ex- amination, Case Closing Procedures. If you agree with the TEB Exam determination.
You may also: Review arbitrage computa

tions and supporting documentation to conﬁrm they’re substantially correct and technically accurate. Review the case ﬁle to identify any factors that might substantially impact the calculations’ accuracy or otherwise affect the claim’s validity.
Document any needed case de- velopment and return the refund claim case to the examiner.

) The following applies to a rebate preparer who is not an attorney, CPA, enrolled agent, enrolled retirement plan agent, or enrolled actuary. The rebate preparer: a. Who prepares a rebate report but doesn’t prepare the correlating form (for example, Form
-R or Form
-T) can’t be a designated repre- sentative of the issuer on Form
b. Can only be designated as an unenrolled return preparer on Form
for a Form
-R or Form
-T that the rebate preparer actually prepared and signed. Note: Even if a rebate preparer who was paid compensation to prepare Form
-R or Form
-T actually signed the return and was eligible to be designated as an unenrolled return preparer on Form
, the rebate preparer would only be permitted to provide limited representation for the issuer. c. May be designated on Form
as an appointee to inspect and/or receive the issuer’s conﬁdential information for the type of tax and the years or periods listed on Form

If designated as an appointee, they aren’t authorized to: • Advocate the issuer’s position on federal tax laws. • Execute waivers, consents, or closing agreements. • Otherwise represent the issuer before the IRS.
4.82.2.20(03-18-2021) Cases Affected by a Federally Declared Disaster
Examiners: a. When IRM
has been published for procedures regarding taxpayers affected by a federally declared disaster, follow those proce- dures, as applicable. In the interim, follow Interim Guidance Memorandum TEGE-
, Guidance for Cases Affected by a Federally Declared Disaster, or Terrorist or Military Action, dated March
, as applicable. b. Immediately discuss any situation or questions about taxpayers affected by a federally declared disaster with your manager.
